revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

{{Speciesbox | image = Psilocybe.atlantis.one.jpg | genus = Psilocybe | species = atlantis | authority = Guzmán, Hanlin & C.White (2003) | range_map = Psilocybe_atlantis_range.png | range_map_upright = 0.5 | range_map_caption = Range of ''Psilocybe atlantis'' }} {{mycomorphbox | name = ''Psilocybe atlantis'' | whichGills = adnate | capShape = conical | capShape2 = convex | hymeniumType = gills | stipeCharacter = bare | ecologicalType = saprotrophic | sporePrintColor = purple-brown | howEdible = psychoactive }} '''''Psilocybe atlantis''''' is a rare [[psychedelic mushroom]] that contains [[psilocybin]] and [[psilocin]] as main active compounds. It is a close relative of ''[[Psilocybe mexicana]]'' and has been recorded only from [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]].{{cite journal | last1 = Guzmán | first1 = G | last2 = Hanlin | first2 = RT | last3 = White | first3 = C. |name-list-format=vanc| year = 2003 | title = Another new bluing species of ''Psilocybe'' from Georgia, U.S.A. | url = | journal = Mycotaxon | volume = 86 | issue = | pages = 179–183 }} It has a pleasant taste and smell. While naturally rare it is often cultivated for its psychedelic properties. ==Description== The [[Pileus (mycology)|cap]] is 2.5–4 cm in diameter, [[conic]] to [[wiktionary:convex|convex]], and smooth to slightly striate, sometimes with a small [[umbo (mycology)|umbo]]. The cap surface is pale brown to reddish brown in color, [[hygrophanous]], and bruises blue where damaged.
Its gills are [[wikt:adnate|subadnate]], thin, and brown.
The [[Stipe (mycology)|stipe]] is 5 cm by .3 cm. It has an equal structure and is brownish with small brown scales, especially towards the base. The stipe also bruises blue where damaged.
''Psilocybe atlantis'' [[spore]]s are 9 x 6 x 5.5 [[μm]] with a broad [[germ pore]]. ==Distribution and habitat== ''Psilocybe atlantis'' has been found in grassy lawns and vacant lots in [[Fulton County, Georgia]]. The original find was made in Fulton County Georgia, growing in a patch of moss beside a 5 year old home whose lot bordered a wooded area within 50 meters of a tributary of the Chattahoochee river. ==Gallery== Image:Psilocybe.atlantis.two.jpg|Psilocybe atlantis Image:Psilocybe.atlantis.three.jpg|Psilocybe atlantis Image:Psilocybe.atlantis.four.jpg|Psilocybe atlantis Image:Psilocybe.atlantis.five.jpg|Psilocybe atlantis Image:Psilocybe.atlantis.six.jpg|Psilocybe atlantis Image:Psilocybe.atlantis.seven.jpg|Psilocybe atlantis Image:Psilocybe.atlantis.eight.jpg|Psilocybe atlantis Image:Psilocybe.atlantis.nine.jpg|Psilocybe atlantis ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Hallucinogenic mushrooms}} {{Taxonbar|from=Q7255846}} [[Category:Entheogens]] [[Category:Psychoactive fungi]] [[Category:Psilocybe|atlantis]] [[Category:Psychedelic tryptamine carriers]] [[Category:Fungi described in 2003]] [[Category:Fungi of the United States]]
